DataElement.preferredName: Eligibility Criteria Myocardial Infarction or Acute Coronary Syndrome or Coronary Revascularization Procedure or Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery Prior to Start Study Drug Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or not the patient had a myocardial infarction, acute coronary syndrome, coronary revascularization procedures, or coronary arterial bypass grafting prior to starting the study drug.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Myocardial Infarction Acute Coronary Syndrome Coronary Revascularization Procedure Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery Prior To Begin Protocol Agent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria._Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis._Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction._Any procedure that is undertaken to reestablished blood flow to the heart._Surgery performed to bypass partially or completely occluded coronary arteries, thereby increasing the blood supply of the heart._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins._A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Myocardial Infarction Acute Coronary Syndrome Coronary Revascularization Procedure Coronary Artery Bypass Surgery Prior To Begin Protocol Agent
Property.preferredDefinition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.:Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction.:Any procedure that is undertaken to reestablished blood flow to the heart.:Surgery performed to bypass partially or completely occluded coronary arteries, thereby increasing the blood supply of the heart.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.:A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Gross necrosis of the myocardium, as a result of interruption of the blood supply to the area, as in coronary thrombosis.

Signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction.
Any procedure that is undertaken to reestablish blood flow to the heart.
Surgery performed to bypass partially or completely occluded coronary arteries, thereby increasing the blood supply of the heart.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ABTC-1601 study in Rave per request by J.Zhao. mc 1/9/17

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the patient have a myocar
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a myocardial infarction, acute coronary syndrome, coronary revascularization procedures, or coronary arterial bypass grafting within 6 months prior to starting study drug?
